topic.title: Adding and Maintaining Routes for a VXLAN Network
topic.shortdesc: You can add or delete routing table entries for hosts on a VXLAN network using the CLI.

body.p: The compute node must be locked.
To add routes, use the following command.
body.codeblock: ~(keystone_admin)$ system host-route-add node ifname network prefix gateway metric

pd.p: is the name or UUID of the compute node
is the name of the interface
is an IPv4 or IPv6 network address
is the netmask length for the network address
is the cost of the route (the number of hops)

body.p: To delete routes, use the following command.
body.codeblock: ~(keystone_admin)$ system host-route-delete uuid ifname network prefix gateway metric
body.p: where uuid is the UUID of the route to be deleted.
